alert.note: Alert for Western Grant (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued May 01 at 8:01AM EDT until May 02 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations around 2 to 4 inches above 3,000 feet with localized amounts around 6 inches possible close to 4,000 feet in western Grant County. For elevations below 3,000 feet, snow accumulations around a coating to a slushy inch or two are expected. Westerly winds will gust frequently around 35 to 45 mph. * WHERE...In Virginia, Western Highland County. In West Virginia, Western Grant County. * WHEN...From 8 PM this evening to 10 AM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The combination of heavy wet snow, strong winds, and green up on trees will enhance the threat for downed trees and power outages above 3,000 feet.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
